prerequisites.title: prerequisites
prerequisites.description: The prerequisites required for this action to run.

dialog.title: dialog
dialog.description: Formatting supported with & and ยง, and @S becomes the player's name

text.title: text
text.description: Text spoken by NPC. '[Name] ' part is handled by the plugin

raw_text.title: raw_text
raw_text.description: No name or formatting included by default

clickable_text.title: clickable_text
clickable_text.description: Colored, formatted, and put in [] for you.

click_type.description: The number state this is. This is mainly use to telegraph whether the NPC has a quest or not. 1 = Acceptable Quest, 2 = Turnin Quest
click_type.title: click_type

prerequisites.description: The prerequisites required for the player to SEE this option. If they do not meet them, this text will not be shown.

player_valid_radius.description: Range that the player is allowed to walk from the point where they were shown the message and still have the dialog work. Default is 4.0.

text.title: text
text.description: The text lines sent to the player

actions.title: actions
actions.description: The actions to perform whenever the dialog is finished

set_scores.title: set_scores
set_scores.description: Set the player's specified scoreboard value(s). Click Properties, then type in the scoreboard name in the input box and click the 'add' button. Scoreboards are case-sensitive

set_questdata.title: set_questdata
set_questdata.description: Set the player's specified Quest Data values(s). Click Properties, then type in the Quest Data ID in the input box and click the 'add' button. Quest Data IDs are case-sensitive

completed.title: completed
completed.description: Set this quest to be completed or not

.*.description: Sets the Quest Data field for the Quest Data ID. Adding a + to the beginning will add to the score. Adding a - to the beginning will subtract from the score.

remove_questdata.title: remove_questdata
remove_questdata.description: Removes the QuestData for the player.

trade.title: trade
trade.description: Opens an RPG Trade for the player to use.

timer_cooldown.title: timer_cooldown
timer_cooldown.description: Puts the player on cooldown with the specified timer and timer tags. This will cause the pre-requisite 'timer_cooldown' to return true.

timer_tags.title: timer_tags
timer_tags.description: Gives the player the specified timer tags. These timer tags are assigned to this specific timer, and the tags will clear once the timer resets.

timer_reset.title: timer_reset
timer_reset.description: Removes the player from the timer cooldown. This will cause the pre-requisite 'timer_cooldown' to return false.

menu.title: menu
menu.description: Opens a Menu for the player to use. Valid arguments: reforges.

open_altar.title: open_altar
open_altar.description: Opens an Enchantment Altar for the player to use. Use the ID

open_profession.title: open_profession
open_profession.description: Opens a player's Profession Menu for a specific profession

professionType.title: professionType
professionType.description: The profession type to open. Valid IDs: BLACKSMITH, ARTISAN, ALCHEMY, COOKING, JEWELER, HERBALISM, MINING, FISHING, SKINNING

location.title: location
location.description: The Location of the profession workstation. Format is world,x,y,z

learn_profession.title: learn_profession
learn_profession.description: Opens the menu for a player to learn the specified profession. This will not open if they have 2 Professions already. Valid IDs: BLACKSMITH, ARTISAN, ALCHEMY, COOKING, JEWELER, HERBALISM, MINING, FISHING, SKINNING

function.title: function
function.description: Runs a function via the console as the player (/execute as <playername> at @s run function <function>)

command.title: command
command.description: Runs a command via the console. Any instance of '@S' (uppercase!) will be replaced with the player's name. Any instance of '@N' (uppercase!) will be replaced with the NPC's UUID, which can be used like @e to target a specific entity. The NPC must be selected by trading or punching to use the entity UUID, or the player will receive an error instead.

run_actions.title: run_actions
run_actions.description: Runs the specified SpellActions on the player or NPC.

on_player.title: on_player
on_player.description: Whether these actions occur on the player or not

y_offset.title: y_offset
y_offset.description: The y-offset for the location value for the actions

give_loot.title: give_loot
give_loot.description: Gives the player all items from a loot table.

give_ability.title: give_ability
give_ability.description: Gives the player the specified ability. This only works if the ability is able to be given. Talk to a Developer to ask which abilities are givable.

give_handbook_entry.title: give_handbook_entry
give_handbook_entry.description: Gives the player the specified Handbook Entry to add to their Player Handbook. If the player already has the handbook entry, this will not do anything.

give_handbook_entries.title: give_handbook_entries
give_handbook_entries.description: Gives the player the specified Handbook Entries to add to their Player Handbook. If the player already has the handbook entries, this will not do anything. USE THIS WHEN ADDING MULTIPLE ENTRIES

give_reward.title: give_reward
give_reward.description: Rewards the player all of the items from given loot tables in a stylized UI.

base_reward.title: base_reward
base_reward.description: The loot table that is given to the player as the base.

pick_reward.title: pick_reward
pick_reward.description: The loot table that contains the loot from which the player has to pick 1 item from. This can be left blank if not intended.

xp.title: xp
xp.description: The amount of experience given to the player.

xp_percent.title: xp_percent
xp_percent.description: Gives XP based on the parameters given using MATHS. The amount of XP it gives correlates to the specified player level and the percentage of XP for the next level after

level.title: level
level.description: The level to base the XP given off of.

xp_percent.title: xp_percent
xp_percent.description: The percentage of XP to give according to the amount of XP needed to get the player from <level> to <level + 1>. This is a decimal from 0 - 1

coins.title: coins
coins.description: The amount of coins given to the player.

quest_components.title: quest_components
quest_components.description: The quest components to run whenever the player accepts the rewards

give_xp.title: give_xp
give_xp.description: Gives the player the amount of XP specified.

give_xp_percent.title: give_xp_percent
give_xp_percent.description: Gives XP based on the parameters given using MATHS. The amount of XP it gives correlates to the specified player level and the percentage of XP for the next level after

level.title: level
level.description: The level to base the XP given off of.

xp_percent.title: xp_percent
xp_percent.description: The percentage of XP to give according to the amount of XP needed to get the player from <level> to <level + 1>. This is a decimal from 0 - 1

interact_npc.title: interact_npc
interact_npc.description: Triggers a follow-on interaction with a different NPC.

name.title: name
name.description: Name of the NPC to have the player interact with.

entity_type.title: entity_type
entity_type.description: EntityType of the NPC to have the player interact with (default is VILLAGER).

voice_over.title: voice_over
voice_over.description: Play a sound to the player as an NPC (WIP)

rerun_components.title: rerun_components
rerun_components.description: Re-runs all quest components tied to this specific NPC (including those specified in other files). To prevent infinite loops, this action will not run itself, even if conditions indicate it should.

drop_loot.title: drop_loot
drop_loot.description: Drops all items fro a loot table for a player on a Quest NPC. If there is no Quest NPC, it defaults to the player instead.

spawn_mob.title: spawn_mob
spawn_mob.description: Spawns mobs at the given locations

mob_id.title: mob_id
mob_id.description: The id of the mob to spawn

world.title: world
world.description: The world that the mob will spawn in. Leave blank to use the world of the player receiving the quest component.

spell_actions.title: spell_actions
spell_actions.description: The actions to run when the mob spawns

enter_shard.title: enter_shard
enter_shard.description: Creates and teleports the player into a Shard Instance given the Shard ID

leave_shard.title: leave_shard
leave_shard.description: Leaves the current shard that the player is in. Leave as 'false' if the player 'exits' the shard, or true if the player 'abandons' the shard.

teleport.title: teleport
teleport.description: Teleports the player to a specific world, location, and rotation. Only use this if you need to teleport a player across worlds. Format: world,x,y,z,yaw,pitch

play_cutscene.title: play_cutscene
play_cutscene.description: Plays a cutscene at the specified origin location, which at the end of the cutscene (or by skipping it) will perform the specified Quest Components.

position.title: position
position.description: The string format of the position in the world to play the cutscene at. Use format x,y,z and integers only!

quest_components.title: quest_components
quest_components.description: The quest components to run whenever the player finishes or skips the cutscene.
